title: Epidemic modelling with Rcpp
text: Prepare population contact data. Prepare initial conditions age group. Prepare population population class object.
code: # load contact and population data from socialmixr::polymod polymod <- socialmixr::polymod contact_data <- socialmixr::contact_matrix(   polymod,   countries = "United Kingdom",   age.limits = c(0, 20, 40),   symmetric = TRUE ) #> Using POLYMOD social contact data. To cite this in a publication, use the 'cite' function #> Removing participants that have contacts without age information. To change this behaviour, set the 'missing.contact.age' option  # prepare contact matrix contact_matrix <- t(contact_data$matrix)  # prepare the demography vector demography_vector <- contact_data$demography$population names(demography_vector) <- rownames(contact_matrix)  # view contact matrix and demography contact_matrix #>                   #> contact.age.group     [,1]     [,2]     [,3] #>           [0,20)  7.883663 2.794154 1.565665 #>           [20,40) 3.120220 4.854839 2.624868 #>           40+     3.063895 4.599893 5.005571  demography_vector #>   [0,20)  [20,40)      40+  #> 14799290 16526302 28961159 # initial conditions initial_i <- 1e-6 initial_conditions <- c(   S = 1 - initial_i, E = 0, I = initial_i, R = 0, V = 0 )  # build for all age groups initial_conditions <- rbind(   initial_conditions,   initial_conditions,   initial_conditions )  # assign rownames for clarity rownames(initial_conditions) <- rownames(contact_matrix)  # view initial conditions initial_conditions #>                S E     I R V #> [0,20)  0.999999 0 1e-06 0 0 #> [20,40) 0.999999 0 1e-06 0 0 #> 40+     0.999999 0 1e-06 0 0 uk_population <- population(   name = "UK",   contact_matrix = contact_matrix,   demography_vector = demography_vector,   initial_conditions = initial_conditions )  uk_population #> $name #> [1] "UK" #>  #> $contact_matrix #>                   #> contact.age.group     [,1]     [,2]     [,3] #>           [0,20)  7.883663 2.794154 1.565665 #>           [20,40) 3.120220 4.854839 2.624868 #>           40+     3.063895 4.599893 5.005571 #>  #> $demography_vector #>   [0,20)  [20,40)      40+  #> 14799290 16526302 28961159  #>  #> $initial_conditions #>                S E     I R V #> [0,20)  0.999999 0 1e-06 0 0 #> [20,40) 0.999999 0 1e-06 0 0 #> 40+     0.999999 0 1e-06 0 0 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "population"

title: Epidemic modelling with Rcpp
code: # Prepare epidemiological parameters r0 <- 1.5 preinfectious_period <- 3 infectious_period <- 7

title: Epidemic modelling with Rcpp
code: # run an epidemic model using `epidemic` output <- epidemic(   population = uk_population,   r0 = r0,   preinfectious_period = preinfectious_period,   infectious_period = infectious_period,   time_end = 600, increment = 1.0 ) #> Intervention: `time_end` is not greater than `time_begin` #> Vaccination: some `time_end`s are not greater than `time_begin`s

title: Epidemic modelling with Rcpp
text: Plot epidemic time, showing number individuals exposed infected compartments.
code: # convert data to a data.table setDT(output)  # make long format data data <- melt(   output[, .SD, .SDcols = names(output) %like%     "infectious|exposed|time"],   id.vars = "time" )  # extract age group and compartment data[, c("compartment", "age_group") := list(   str_extract(variable, "(\\w+)(?=_)"),   str_extract(variable, "\\d{1}") )]  # assign age groups age_groups <- data.table(   age_group = as.character(seq_along(demography_vector)),   age_group_name = names(demography_vector) )  data <- merge(data, age_groups) # plot figure of epidemic curve ggplot(   data,   aes(     x = time,     y = value,     col = age_group_name,     linetype = compartment   ) ) +   geom_line() +   scale_y_continuous(     labels = scales::comma   ) +   scale_colour_brewer(     palette = "Dark2",     name = "Age group"   ) +   expand_limits(     y = c(0, 500e3)   ) +   coord_cartesian(     expand = FALSE   ) +   theme_classic() +   theme(     legend.position = "top"   ) +   labs(     x = "Simulation time (days)",     linetype = "Compartment",     y = "Individuals"   )

title: Modelling interventions
text: Prepare population contact data. Prepare initial conditions age group. Prepare population population class object.
code: # load contact and population data from socialmixr::polymod polymod <- socialmixr::polymod contact_data <- socialmixr::contact_matrix(   polymod,   countries = "United Kingdom",   age.limits = c(0, 20, 40),   symmetric = TRUE ) #> Using POLYMOD social contact data. To cite this in a publication, use the 'cite' function #> Removing participants that have contacts without age information. To change this behaviour, set the 'missing.contact.age' option  # prepare contact matrix contact_matrix <- t(contact_data$matrix)  # prepare the demography vector demography_vector <- contact_data$demography$population names(demography_vector) <- rownames(contact_matrix) # initial conditions initial_i <- 1e-6 initial_conditions <- c(   S = 1 - initial_i, E = 0, I = initial_i, R = 0, V = 0 )  # build for all age groups initial_conditions <- rbind(   initial_conditions,   initial_conditions,   initial_conditions )  # assign rownames for clarity rownames(initial_conditions) <- rownames(contact_matrix) uk_population <- population(   name = "UK",   contact_matrix = contact_matrix,   demography_vector = demography_vector,   initial_conditions = initial_conditions )

title: Modelling interventions
code: # Prepare epidemiological parameters r0 <- 1.5 preinfectious_period <- 3 infectious_period <- 7

title: Modelling interventions
text: Prepare intervention simulate school closures.
code: # prepare an intervention with a differential effect on age groups close_schools <- intervention(   name = "School closure",   time_begin = 200,   time_end = 300,   contact_reduction = c(0.5, 0.001, 0.001) )  # examine the intervention object close_schools #> $name #> [1] "School closure" #>  #> $time_begin #> [1] 200 #>  #> $time_end #> [1] 300 #>  #> $contact_reduction #> [1] 0.500 0.001 0.001 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "intervention"

title: Modelling interventions
code: # run an epidemic model using `epidemic` output <- epidemic(   population = uk_population,   r0 = r0,   preinfectious_period = preinfectious_period,   infectious_period = infectious_period,   intervention = close_schools,   time_end = 600, increment = 1.0 ) #> Vaccination: some `time_end`s are not greater than `time_begin`s

title: Modelling interventions
text: Plot epidemic time, showing number individuals exposed infected compartments.
code: # convert data to a data.table setDT(output)  # make long format data data <- melt(   output[, .SD, .SDcols = names(output) %like%     "infectious|exposed|time"],   id.vars = "time" )  # extract age group and compartment data[, c("compartment", "age_group") := list(   str_extract(variable, "(\\w+)(?=_)"),   str_extract(variable, "\\d{1}") )]  # assign age groups age_groups <- data.table(   age_group = as.character(seq_along(demography_vector)),   age_group_name = names(demography_vector) )  data <- merge(data, age_groups) # plot figure of epidemic curve ggplot(   data,   aes(     x = time,     y = value,     col = age_group_name,     linetype = compartment   ) ) +   geom_line() +   annotate(     geom = "rect",     xmin = close_schools$time_begin,     xmax = close_schools$time_end,     ymin = 0, ymax = 500e3,     fill = alpha("red", alpha = 0.2),     lty = "dashed"   ) +   annotate(     geom = "text",     x = mean(c(close_schools$time_begin, close_schools$time_end)),     y = 400e3,     angle = 90,     label = "School closure"   ) +   scale_y_continuous(     labels = scales::comma   ) +   scale_colour_brewer(     palette = "Dark2",     name = "Age group"   ) +   expand_limits(     y = c(0, 500e3)   ) +   coord_cartesian(     expand = FALSE   ) +   theme_classic() +   theme(     legend.position = "top"   ) +   labs(     x = "Simulation time (days)",     linetype = "Compartment",     y = "Individuals"   )

title: Modelling a vaccination campaign
text: Prepare population contact data. Prepare initial conditions age group. Prepare population population class object.
code: # load contact and population data from socialmixr::polymod polymod <- socialmixr::polymod contact_data <- socialmixr::contact_matrix(   polymod,   countries = "United Kingdom",   age.limits = c(0, 20, 65),   symmetric = TRUE ) #> Using POLYMOD social contact data. To cite this in a publication, use the 'cite' function #> Removing participants that have contacts without age information. To change this behaviour, set the 'missing.contact.age' option  # prepare contact matrix contact_matrix <- t(contact_data$matrix)  # prepare the demography vector demography_vector <- contact_data$demography$population names(demography_vector) <- rownames(contact_matrix) # initial conditions initial_i <- 1e-6 initial_conditions <- c(   S = 1 - initial_i, E = 0, I = initial_i, R = 0, V = 0 )  # build for all age groups initial_conditions <- rbind(   initial_conditions,   initial_conditions,   initial_conditions )  # assign rownames for clarity rownames(initial_conditions) <- rownames(contact_matrix) uk_population <- population(   name = "UK",   contact_matrix = contact_matrix,   demography_vector = demography_vector,   initial_conditions = initial_conditions )

title: Modelling a vaccination campaign
code: # Prepare epidemiological parameters r0 <- 1.5 preinfectious_period <- 3 infectious_period <- 7

title: Modelling a vaccination campaign
text: Prepare vaccination campaign targeting individuals aged 65.
code: # prepare a vaccination object vaccinate_elders <- vaccination(   name = "vaccinate elders",   time_begin = rep(100, nrow(contact_matrix)),   time_end = rep(250, nrow(contact_matrix)),   nu = c(0.0001, 0.0001, 0.0001) )  # view vaccination object vaccinate_elders #> $name #> [1] "vaccinate elders" #>  #> $time_begin #> [1] 100 100 100 #>  #> $time_end #> [1] 250 250 250 #>  #> $nu #> [1] 1e-04 1e-04 1e-04 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "vaccination"

title: Modelling a vaccination campaign
code: # run an epidemic model using `epidemic` output <- epidemic(   population = uk_population,   r0 = r0,   preinfectious_period = preinfectious_period,   infectious_period = infectious_period,   vaccination = vaccinate_elders,   time_end = 600, increment = 1.0 ) #> Intervention: `time_end` is not greater than `time_begin`

title: Modelling a vaccination campaign
text: Plot epidemic time, showing number individuals exposed, infected, vaccinated compartments.
code: # convert data to a data.table setDT(output)  # make long format data data <- melt(   output[, .SD, .SDcols = names(output) %like%     "infectious|exposed|vaccinated|time"],   id.vars = "time" )  # extract age group and compartment data[, c("compartment", "age_group") := list(   str_extract(variable, "(\\w+)(?=_)"),   str_extract(variable, "\\d{1}") )]  # assign age groups age_groups <- data.table(   age_group = as.character(seq_along(demography_vector)),   age_group_name = names(demography_vector) )  data <- merge(data, age_groups) # plot figure of epidemic curve ggplot(   data,   aes(     x = time,     y = value,     col = age_group_name,     linetype = compartment   ) ) +   geom_line() +   scale_y_continuous(     labels = scales::comma   ) +   scale_colour_brewer(     palette = "Dark2",     name = "Age group"   ) +   expand_limits(     y = c(0, 500e3)   ) +   coord_cartesian(     expand = FALSE   ) +   theme_classic() +   theme(     legend.position = "top"   ) +   labs(     x = "Simulation time (days)",     linetype = "Compartment",     y = "Individuals"   )

code: check_args_default(mod_args)

what: Run an age-structured SEIR-V epidemic model — .epidemic_default_cpp
title: Run an age-structured SEIR-V epidemic model — .epidemic_default_cpp
text: compartmental model optional non-pharmaceutical intervention optional vaccination regime. Allows heterogeneity social contact patterns, variable sizes demographic groups. Also allows group-specific initial proportions model compartment, well group-specific vaccination start dates vaccination rates, also group-specific effects implementing non-pharmaceutical intervention. model allows single, population-wide rates transition 'susceptible' 'exposed' compartments, 'exposed' 'infectious' compartments, recovery rate.

title: Run an age-structured SEIR-V epidemic model — .epidemic_default_cpp
code: .epidemic_default_cpp(   population,   beta,   alpha,   gamma,   intervention,   vaccination,   time_end = 200,   increment = 0.1 )

title: Run an age-structured SEIR-V epidemic model — .epidemic_default_cpp
text: population object population class, holds population contact matrix, demography vector, initial conditions demographic group. See population(). beta transmission rate \(\beta\). alpha rate transition exposed infectious \(\alpha\). gamma recovery rate \(\gamma\). intervention non-pharamaceutical intervention applied course epidemic, start end time, age-specific effect contacts. See intervention(). vaccination vaccination regime followed course epidemic, start end time, age-specific effect transition individuals susceptible vaccinated. See vaccination(). time_end maximum time, defaults 200.0. increment increment time, defaults 0.1.

title: Run an age-structured SEIR-V epidemic model — .epidemic_default_cpp
text: two element list, first element list matrices whose elements correspond numbers individuals compartment specified initial conditions matrix (see population()). second list element vector timesteps.

title: Model an epidemic — epidemic
text: Simulate epidemic using deterministic, compartmental epidemic model package's library epidemic models. option currently available SEIR-V model, compartments "susceptible", "exposed", "infectious", "recovered", "vaccinated".

title: Model an epidemic — epidemic
code: epidemic(model = "default", ...)

title: Model an epidemic — epidemic
text: model string epidemic model. currently supported option "default", default SEIR-V model. ... Arguments model specified model. See Details supported arguments.

title: Model an epidemic — epidemic
text: data.frame columns "time", "compartment", "age_group", "value". compartments correspond compartments model chosen model. current default model compartments "susceptible", "exposed", "infectious", "recovered", "vaccinated".

title: Model an epidemic — epidemic
text: Arguments passed ... may differ depending model specified model. default model (model = "default") takes following arguments. population object population class, holds population contact matrix, demography vector, initial conditions demographic group. See population(). r0 reproductive number infection, \(R_0\). Must number vector numbers length number demographic groups, depending model implemented. 'default' model requires single number. preinfectious_period mean infectious period. Must number vector numbers length number demographic groups, depending model implemented. 'default' model requires single number. infectious_period mean infections period. Must number vector numbers length number demographic groups, depending model implemented. 'default' model requires single number. intervention non-pharmaceutical intervention applied population epidemic. See intervention(). optional argument default model. vaccination vaccination regime followed course epidemic, start end time, age-specific effect transition individuals susceptible vaccinated. See vaccination(). optional argument default model. time_end maximum number timesteps run model. increment size time increment.

title: Model an epidemic — epidemic

what: epidemics: A Library of Epidemic Compartmental Models — epidemics-package
title: epidemics: A Library of Epidemic Compartmental Models — epidemics-package
text: Model epidemics using compartmental models.

what: Construct a new intervention for an epidemic model — intervention
title: Construct a new intervention for an epidemic model — intervention
text: Construct new intervention epidemic model

title: Construct a new intervention for an epidemic model — intervention
code: intervention(name = NA_character_, time_begin, time_end, contact_reduction)

title: Construct a new intervention for an epidemic model — intervention
text: name String name intervention. time_begin Single number start time intervention. time_end Single number end time intervention. contact_reduction vector length number demographic groups target population, gives overall group-specific proportion reduction contacts respectively.

title: Construct a new intervention for an epidemic model — intervention
text: object intervention S3 class.

title: Construct a new intervention for an epidemic model — intervention
code: # assuming a population with two age groups, 0 -- 18, and 18+ # an example in which schools are closed for 30 days (or other time units) close_schools <- intervention(   name = "close schools",   time_begin = 50,   time_end = 80,   contact_reduction = c(0.5, 0.01) # reduces contacts differentially )

what: Convert epidemic model output to a data.frame — output_to_df
title: Convert epidemic model output to a data.frame — output_to_df
text: Convert epidemic model output data.frame

title: Convert epidemic model output to a data.frame — output_to_df
code: output_to_df(   l,   compartments = c("susceptible", "exposed", "infectious", "recovered", "vaccinated") )

title: Convert epidemic model output to a data.frame — output_to_df
text: l list, usually output call .epidemic_default_cpp(). compartments character vector compartment names.

title: Convert epidemic model output to a data.frame — output_to_df
text: data.frame N+1 columns, N number compartments, additional column "time".

what: Construct a new population for an epidemic model — population
title: Construct a new population for an epidemic model — population
text: Construct new population epidemic model

title: Construct a new population for an epidemic model — population
code: population(   name = NA_character_,   contact_matrix = matrix(1),   demography_vector = 6.7e+07,   initial_conditions = matrix() )

title: Construct a new population for an epidemic model — population
text: name Optional string population name. contact_matrix matrix giving contacts demographic groups population. Must square matrix. demography_vector vector sizes demographic group. Must length dimensions contact matrix. initial_conditions Matrix representing initial proportions demographic group four model compartments: 'susceptible', 'infected/infectious', 'recovered', 'vaccinated'. Must many rows number demographic groups. compartment represented columns matrix, element \(M_{ij}\) represents proportion individuals demographic group \(\) compartment \(j\) .

title: Construct a new population for an epidemic model — population
text: object population S3 class.

title: Construct a new population for an epidemic model — population
code: population(   name = "UK population",   contact_matrix = matrix(1),   demography_vector = 67e6,   initial_conditions = matrix(     c(0.9999, 0.0001, 0, 0),     nrow = 1, ncol = 4   ) ) #> $name #> [1] "UK population" #>  #> $contact_matrix #>      [,1] #> [1,]    1 #>  #> $demography_vector #> [1] 6.7e+07 #>  #> $initial_conditions #>        [,1]  [,2] [,3] [,4] #> [1,] 0.9999 1e-04    0    0 #>  #> attr(,"class") #> [1] "population"

what: Construct a new vaccination regime for an epidemic model — vaccination
title: Construct a new vaccination regime for an epidemic model — vaccination
text: Construct new vaccination regime epidemic model

title: Construct a new vaccination regime for an epidemic model — vaccination
code: vaccination(name = NA_character_, time_begin, time_end, nu)

title: Construct a new vaccination regime for an epidemic model — vaccination
text: name String name vaccination regime. time_begin Vector start time vaccination demographic group \(\). time_end Vector end time vaccination demographic group \(\). nu Vector length number demographic groups, gives group-specific rate vaccination, expressed rate parameter \(nu\).

title: Construct a new vaccination regime for an epidemic model — vaccination
text: object vaccination S3 class.

title: Construct a new vaccination regime for an epidemic model — vaccination
code: # assuming a population with two age groups, children 0 -- 5, and others 5+ # an example for childhood vaccination only childhood_vaccination <- vaccination(   name = "childhood_vaccination",   time_begin = c(0, 100), # assuming a simulation over 100 days   time_end = c(100, 100),   nu = c(0.0001, 0.0) # over 5s never vaccinated ) #> Vaccination: some `time_end`s are not greater than `time_begin`s
